subject: Re: Hi, I am a newbie.
msgSnippet: ... I ll second that.  A great article. ... Have a look at Jemmy as well.  I started using JFCUnit, but I found Jemmy much easier to use and better overall:
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Bernd" <berndq@g...> wrote:
> > Hi,
> > I am new in this group. I started using junit 7 days
> > ago. It works very well with the classes without any
> > GUI. But how do you use it to test JFC Swing stuff?
>
> You should also look at
> http://www.objectmentor.com/resources/articles/TheHumbleDialogBox.pdf

I'll second that. A great article.

> > What is JFCUnit, where can I get it?

Have a look at Jemmy as well. I started using JFCUnit, but I found
Jemmy much easier to use and better overall:

http://jemmy.netbeans.org/

I hope to have a paper at XP2003 talking about using the humble dialog
approach and Jemmy to test drive Swing GUIs.

Dave
